text.p: Let [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] be the set of real polynomials of degree at most 6 which have no terms of odd degree (that is, polynomials such as [mathjaxinline]3t^6 + 2t^2 -1[/mathjaxinline] that do not include a [mathjaxinline]t^5, t^3,[/mathjaxinline] or [mathjaxinline]t^1[/mathjaxinline] term). This is a subspace of [mathjaxinline]\mathbb {P_6}[/mathjaxinline]. What is the dimension of [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline]?

font.p: [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] is all polynomials of the form [mathjaxinline]a_0 + a_2t^2 + a_4t^4 + a_6t^6[/mathjaxinline]; i.e., the span of [mathjaxinline]\{ 1; t^2; t^4; t^6\}[/mathjaxinline]. This is a linearly independent list which spans [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline], so it is a basis of [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline]. The dimension of [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] is thus the number of elements of that list.
